channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Raffles City Shopping Centre, VivoCity cinema visited by infectious Covid-19 patients
item.description:
July 23, 2020 10:43 PM

There were 354 new coronavirus cases confirmed on Thursday, taking Singapore's total to 49,098.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singapore and Japan will work towards resuming essential travel
item.description:
July 23, 2020 10:23 PM

SINGAPORE - Singapore welcomes Japan's move to include the Republic in discussions on the resumption of essential travel and will work closely with Japan to make progress in this area, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA) said on Thursday (Jul 23).

item.title: Coronavirus: Leisure travel not happening any time soon as countries continue to play safe, say experts
item.description:
July 23, 2020 9:39 PM

SINGAPORE - No recreational travel is likely this year or early next year as countries that are still knee-deep in the Covid-19 pandemic, continue to play safe and keep tourists away.

item.title: Singapore Botanic Gardens' 5th anniversary as Unesco site to be marked with SSO virtual concert
item.description:
July 23, 2020 9:11 PM

SINGAPORE - To celebrate the Singapore Botanic Gardens' 5th anniversary as a Unesco World Heritage Site, the National Parks Board (NParks) has teamed up with the Singapore Symphony Orchestra (SSO) to hold a virtual concert this year.

item.title: Covid-19 deaths kept low in dorms because older and sicker migrant workers were isolated first: Prof Dale Fisher
item.description:
July 23, 2020 8:48 PM

SINGAPORE - Although around 247,000 migrant workers living in dormitories have either recovered or tested to be free of Covid-19, the daily new cases continue to remain in the few hundreds.

item.title: Covid-19 unlikely to be spread through air-conditioning: Expert
item.description:
July 23, 2020 8:44 PM

SINGAPORE - It is unlikely that Covid-19 can be spread through air-conditioning, even if the virus causing the disease is airborne, said infectious diseases experts here.

item.title: Coronavirus: Experts pinpoint how Singapore can avoid a second wave of infection
item.description:
July 23, 2020 8:31 PM

SINGAPORE - Experts are optimistic that Singapore can avoid a second wave of Covid-19 cases as long as people do not take unnecessary risks, like gathering in large groups for parties or meals.

item.title: RSAF in talks with US Defence Department on training location for next-generation F-35B
item.description:
July 23, 2020 7:50 PM

SINGAPORE - Discussions with the United States on possible training locations for the Republic of Singapore Air Force's (RSAF's) next-generation F-35B Joint Strike Fighters are ongoing, the Ministry of Defence (Mindef) said on Thursday (July 23).

item.title: Effective vaccine and treatment, and individual action key to stem Covid-19 transmission, say experts
item.description:
July 23, 2020 7:10 PM

They warned that even the best vaccine will be no panacea on its own.

item.title: Malaysians rush home to avoid quarantine in designated facilities
item.description:
July 23, 2020 6:17 PM

SINGAPORE - Mrs Toh Siew Choo had planned to return home in Johor Baru on Sunday (July 26).

item.title: Evening Update: Today's headlines from The Straits Times on July 23
item.description:
July 23, 2020 6:15 PM

Good evening! Catch up on some of the main headlines on Thursday, July 23.

item.title: Task force guiding S'pore to post-Covid-19 recovery urges Govt to be open to private sector-led recommendations
item.description:
July 23, 2020 6:14 PM

SINGAPORE - Concerns about protecting lives amid the Covid-19 pandemic have evolved to the protection of livelihoods, and the Emerging Stronger Taskforce on Thursday (July 23) urged the Government to be open to the solutions it will offer by early next year.

item.title: NTU undergrads must take new interdisciplinary core curriculum from next year
item.description:
July 23, 2020 6:00 PM

SINGAPORE - From August next year, undergraduates entering Nanyang Technological University (NTU) will have to take up a common core curriculum that will enable them to make connections across disciplines and develop interdisciplinary knowledge and skills.

item.title: Great Singapore Sale goes digital this year, with virtual showrooms, interactive games and personalised catalogues
item.description:
July 23, 2020 4:16 PM

SINGAPORE - For the first time since it started 26 years ago, the Great Singapore Sale will be a largely virtual event, with a focus on further helping local retailers go digital.

item.title: Retrenched workers: Govt will be generous with support but firms also need to 'play ball', says Tharman
item.description:
July 23, 2020 4:06 PM

The challenge of keeping Singapore's unemployment figures down will "grow in the months to come", said Mr Tharman.

item.title: Pandan-smelling water from Malaysia has been 'isolated'; local water production ramped up to meet demand: PUB
item.description:
July 23, 2020 3:41 PM

The cause of the scent is an organic compound known as tetrahydrofuran, which is commonly used as a solvent in industries.

item.title: Secondary schools, JCs, Millennia Institute can resume lower-risk CCAs from July 27
item.description:
July 23, 2020 3:26 PM

Such activities in primary schools will resume at a later date, after MOE has assessed how the resumption of CCAs has worked out for older students.

item.title: 354 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, including 8 in the community and 5 imported
item.description:
July 23, 2020 3:14 PM

The community cases comprise four Singaporeans or permanent residents and four work pass holders.

item.title: Money FM: Podcasts of the week (20 July)
Coronavirus: Residents of flat among 5 people charged over Compassvale Crescent gathering
item.description:
July 23, 2020 12:41 PM

SINGAPORE - Two residents of a Sengkang flat were among five people who appeared in a district court on Thursday (July 23) over an unlawful gathering in May during the circuit breaker period.

item.title: Khaw Boon Wan diagnosed with dengue fever after admission to isolation ward
item.description:
July 23, 2020 12:40 PM

Mr Khaw only recently finalised negotiations for the Johor Baru-Singapore Rapid Transit System, and was looking forward to the ceremony

item.title: New MP Jamus Lim elected to Economic Society of Singapore's council
item.description:
July 23, 2020 10:02 AM

He is among seven new faces on the 36-member council.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on July 23
Eight among group of 18 allegedly met in flat during circuit breaker
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Eight people among a group of 18 who met up in a flat during the circuit breaker period were charged in court yesterday with breaching Covid-19 restrictions.

item.title: Staycation, F&B deals rolled out to drive local spending
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Dining and staycation deals are among the 80 promotions that have been created for local residents on the new SingapoRedis-covers microsite, with more to be added over the next nine months.

item.title: 23 recipients of PSC scholarship proceeding with studies this year
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

When she was just 16 years old, Ms Sundaram Mohan Shakthi learnt that the Singapore Police Force (SPF) is not about "just catching and punishing criminals".

item.title: Buffer of hotel rooms needed for use as Covid-19 facilities
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

More than half of the 67,000 hotel rooms in Singapore are currently being used in the battle against Covid-19, Singapore Tourism Board (STB) chief executive Keith Tan revealed on Tuesday.

item.title: Public servants must apply solutions to Singapore context: Chan Chun Sing
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Those in the public service must continually challenge their own perspectives and learn to apply solutions to various problems in the Singapore context, said Trade and Industry Minister Chan Chun Sing.

item.title: Domestic campaign offers hope amid bleak outlook, say businesses
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Visiting the Philippines is a yearly tradition for Mrs Archaenne Chuang, whose extended family lives in Manila.

item.title: Veteran coach gets 21 months' jail for molesting teen athlete
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Veteran track and field coach Loh Siang Piow was yesterday sentenced to 21 months' jail for molesting a teenage athlete twice in 2013.

item.title: No big shifts in Singapore's tourism plans for longer term
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore has not made any big changes in its medium-to long-term tourism investment plans as a result of the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: More than a third of coffee shops get SG Clean certification
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Around 400 of the 1,100 coffee shops islandwide have received the SG Clean certification since it was introduced in February, said the Public Hygiene Council (PHC) yesterday.

item.title: STB to trial hybrid format for two business events
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Two business events, each with on-site attendance of up to 50 people, plus virtual attendance of many others, will take place in Singapore in the next two months.

item.title: COE prices lower except for Open category
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Certificate of entitlement (COE) prices mostly ended lower at the latest tender yesterday - the second after a three-month suspension.

item.title: CAAS, EU counterpart ink deal on safe air travel
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

The Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore (CAAS) and the European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) will collaborate to create common standards to promote safe air travel amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Lee Yi Shyan: Simple joy in everyday interactions with community
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Looking back on his 14 years as an MP, Mr Lee Yi Shyan marvels at how he survived the most hectic days.

item.title: Changi Village Hawker Centre among sites visited by Covid-19 cases
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Changi Village Hawker Centre has been added to the list of places visited by Covid-19 patients while they were infectious, the Ministry of Health (MOH) said yesterday.

item.title: More than 1,300 apply to join ST's Covid-19 webinar
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

All 1,000 places for an online webinar on Covid-19 to be hosted by The Straits Times today were snapped up within a day of the webinar's announcement, and more than 300 readers were on the waitlist as of last night.

item.title: Wheelchair user acts as 'mystery shopper' for bus firm
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Wheelchair user Kishon Chong has been regularly posing as a commuter on Tower Transit public buses since last month - as part of his job. During such trips, the 28-year-old customer experience and inclusivity officer, who is paralysed from the waist down, acts as a "mystery shopper" of sorts.

item.title: $45m campaign launched to revive local tourism industry
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

A $45 million campaign will be rolled out to drive local spending to Singapore's eateries, shops and leisure attractions, which are reeling from a tourist drought caused by the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: 10 accused of unlawful gathering, alcohol consumption
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Ten people appeared in a district court yesterday after they allegedly failed to comply with safe distancing measures amid the Covid-19 outbreak and met one another to consume alcohol.

item.title: Masagos warns against complacency as beaches get crowded
item.description:
July 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Since early this month, more popular beachfronts at East Coast Park have been segmented by the National Parks Board (NParks) to control crowds. NParks also temporarily closes sections when they get too crowded.
